Posts.Content: Thank you for replying back. It is amzing how many people blindly do whatever the Dr's tell them, I do have breast cance and my husband died Sept, 29, 2009 of brain cancer, so I do have a vested interest in preventing the disease from  doing any furthter damage to me or my family. I had a lumpectomy for my Stage II invasice, lobular carcinoma, with lymph node involvment. I had radiation but have chosen not to do chemo. I haven't really felt sick until I started taking the Arimidex. I also knew putting chemo drugs in my body is poison and would definately feel like hell. I did change my diet, attitude, exercise and stress levels. None of it is easy, especially since I teach 5th grade full time and have a very challenging class this year. (in addition to son in rehab and dad just put in alzeimer's ward-NO STRESS!!!) We need to be making informed decisions about our health care. Read!!! I will add grapeseed to my extensive list of natural cures (flax seed, tumeric, QO10, fish oil, salmon, oatmeal, soy...)
Posts.Title: Grapeseed Extract induces apoptosis in Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I'm with you..I did get some good news. I got results back from Oncotype DX test which gives you a high/med/low risk ranking based on you tumor markers. I'm a 6, which at the low end of low risk. This give me a sense of peace with my decsion not to do chemo, oh yea!!! I've read several things about the test and it would only decrease my recurence rate by 2-3%, just not worth putting all those poisons in my body. Start radiation in 2 weeks nad tehn estrogen blocker...maybe. Don't really like all the side effects of that either.   Take Care,        Patrice
Posts.Title: tomaxofin and other meds.

Posts.Content: Just saw pathology report and apparently I have lobular breast cancer...just lost my husband Sept 29 to brain cancer. WTF Don't know much of anything yet, have Dr. appt Monday with best in DC area Dr. Katherine Alley. I do drink green tea bu just regular kind from grocery store. Is there a more potent, stronger version at heatly food store you can recommend> I'm ready to fight   Patrice
Posts.Title: tomaxofin and other meds.

Posts.Content: Just came across your response, I'm just starting on this journey and had a few questions. I have Stage 2 invasive lobular, HER/neg  estrogen receptors but not progesterone. I had lumpectomy Aug 4  2 out of 4 nodes had cancer, and they tok out 5 ml from left breast. I'm trying to make informed decisions about radiation, chemo, estrogen inhibitors. My husband died Sept 29, 09 of brain cancer so I watched him go thru the worst!!! I don't mind doing the radiation but am opposed to chemo and it sounds like the estrogen inhibitors SUCK!!! I've changed my diet-no sugar, fruits/veggies/protein. I would like to do it as naturally as possible I just turned 55 and today is my first day back in the classroom. ot sure how all this is going to play out as I have to face 28 10 year olds all day  HELP!!   Patrice
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: I just got results back from Oncotype DX and I'm a 6 (thank God). My husband died of brain cancer 9/29/09 so this was the first bit of good news in a while.I'm stage 2 invasive lobular w/2 postitive lymph nodes. I think my oncologist (same one my husband had) still wants me to do chemo, but I'm refusing it. I'm confident I can change diet, take supplements, stay postive, pray, try to remain stress free. I beliveve the Dr.s have to recommend chemo for most patients to prevent law suits. Do some research, for me to do chemo would only change my by 1-3%  for recurrence. To me those numbers don't warrant putting all those poisons in my body, to feel like crap, be nauseous & bald! Don't know if this helped-hang in there
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx testing and decisions made

Posts.Content: You go girl!! I love the fact that women are doing the research and making informed decisions about our health. I'm just starting my journey-had lumpectomy Aug. 4, then they had to go back in and take out 12 more nodes , found 2 positive with 1st surgery. Just got Oncotype DX results , I'm a 6, low risk so I've decided not to do chemo. Saw what it did to my husband (died 9/29/09 brain cancer) and I didn't want to do that. I realize they are two very different types of cancer-I get it Dr's , but none the less my body, my choice! Will do radiation, but not conviced I want to do estrogen blocker. Would like to see data. The side effects worry me. I teach 5th grade and have no time to be sick-28 kids counting on me. I may try it, but if side effects are too terrible (I read some women can't get out of bed!!) I'll take myself off of it. Also have changed diet-no sugar, lots of fruits, veggies, supplements, blah , blah , blah. I am women hear me roar, I'm not going to give this cancer any porwer over me...kind of like saying FU to cancer!   Patrice
